docs.lead_paragraph: On Friday, the Boston Red Sox will arrive at Yankee Stadium for a four-game series. When Boston came to New York last August, they were only two and a half games out of first place. In 2008, they were four and a half out of first when they made the August trip. And in 2007, the Red Sox were in first place, by seven and a half games, when they traveled to Yankee Stadium in August. This year, though, it is a different story. The Red Sox are further behind the Yankees - six and a half games going into Thursday's games.
docs.abstract: Steve Lombardi Keeping Score column examines the impact of Boston Red Sox losing ace pitcher Josh Beckett due to injuries; notes that since Beckett returned from the disabled list, the Red Sox have won all three games he started; photos; tables (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: IN the expansion draft that created the Mets, the team made Hobie Landrith their first pick. Why, Casey Stengel was asked, did the Mets select a catcher first? ''You gotta have someone back there to catch the ball,'' Stengel replied as only he could. ''Otherwise, you're gonna have a lot of passed balls.''

docs.snippet: It's good that the Boston Red Sox signed a first baseman, but signing J.T. Snow did not satisfy all of their needs....

docs.lead_paragraph: Edgar Renteria has wide brown eyes, a round face and a soft voice, which combine to make him look a lot younger and lot more innocent than he really is. Renteria often seems as if he is trying to find the easiest place to hide on the Boston Red Sox, the best cubbyhole until he can play baseball and then vanish. But there are no places to hide on the Red Sox, especially when you are a $40 million free-agent shortstop trying to become acclimated. Renteria has quickly seen the endless scrutiny, high expectations and year-round passion that surrounds a team that ended an 86-year drought with a World Series title last October.
docs.snippet: After a slow start, Boston shortstop Edgar Renteria is 12 for 19 in the last five games, raising his average by 42 points, to .281....

headline.main: With Hot Bat, Renteria No Longer Needs to Hide, but He Tries to Anyway

docs.lead_paragraph: PITY the Boston Red Sox. They wait 86 years to win a World Series, and now they have to forget it. That's what their manager, Terry Francona, is telling them, that's what they're telling themselves, and that's what they're telling everyone else. ''I'm very proud of what we did last year,'' Terry Francona said on the day before the team's first workout for pitchers and catchers. ''Right now I care more about what we're going to do this year. For me, going through it was a lot of fun and I was very proud, but I don't want for one minute to get lost what we need to do in '05. If we lose sight of that, what we did in '04 isn't going to mean much for very long.''
docs.abstract: Murray Chass On Baseball column discusses Boston Red Sox, which will try to put World Series win of last season behind them to focus on winning next season; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Pity the Boston Red Sox. They wait 86 years to win a World Series, and now they have to forget it....
